intro: Blepharochloa, commonly known as the "eyelash grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often in shaded or woodland areas. Blepharochloa species are generally herbaceous, with some varieties exhibiting rhizomatous growth. Its name is derived from the Greek words "blepharon" meaning eyelash and "chloa" meaning grass, referring to the fine, feathery appearance of its foliage.
